intro: Arabidopsis huetii, commonly known as the Huetii thale cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. Native to the Canary Islands, it is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It is closely related to Arabidopsis thaliana, another well-known model organism in plant biology.
